intro: Drimia raogibikei, commonly known as the Raogibikei dragon's tongue, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-like, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
